pageTitle: Tennessee Department of State: Tennessee State Library and Archives
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {79404=Tennessee State Library and Archives 403 7th Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243 615-741-2764 reference.tsla@tn.gov, 3201=Most "school census records" or "scholastic population" census records are 20th century records, the result of a law passed by the General Assembly in 1945 (Public Chapter 141). The law required the enumeration of children under 18, listing the full name, date of birth, age, gender, nationality, place of residence, name and address of parent or responsible adult, name and location of the school attended, distance of school from the home, and name and address of the employer of any child. These school census records begin in 1946; the last one was in 1968. Availability varies from county to county., 78920=Research prepared by Mai Thacker   /  Updated August 3, 2012, 4057=For more information on school census records, and a sample page, see Shirley Wilson's article "Tennessee's Scholastic Census Records" in Middle Tennessee Genealogy, v. 6, #2, Fall, 1992, pp. 65-66., 79947=© 2009 Tennessee Department of State}
textBeforeTable: Benton County 16mm A 4215  &  A 4216  (indexed) School Census 1956 16mm A 4213  &  A 4214  (indexed) School Census 1952 16mm A 4211  &  A 4212  (indexed) School Census 1948 Format Microfilm Roll # Title Year   Anderson County Books and periodicals with school census information can be searched by TSLA staff.  E-mail your request to TSLA with the name of the individual you are researching;  please be sure to include the title and call number of the book or periodical.  Due to the number of requests received daily, we ask that you only submit one request at a time for a single name to be searched in one published source.   Only one request will be handled at a time.   Please do not send a second search request while you have a request pending.   Please do not send several searches in separate e-mail messages, or a request that asks to search multiple names.   When you receive a reply to your first look-up, you may send in your next  look-up
